title: Here are the vector methods and their slice-manipulation analogues:

inline_content.Text: Here are the vector methods and their slice-manipulation analogues:

content_resolved.code: a = append(a, b...)
a = append(a[:i], a[j:]...)

a[i] = a[len(a)-1] 
a = a[:len(a)-1]

problem: some elements with values are still referenced by slice
and thus can not be collected. The following code can fix this problem:

title:
copy(a[i:], a[i+1:])
a[len(a)-1] = nil // or the zero value of T
a = a[:len(a)-1]

content_resolved.code:
copy(a[i:], a[i+1:])
a[len(a)-1] = nil // or the zero value of T
a = a[:len(a)-1]

title:
a[i] = a[len(a)-1]
a[len(a)-1] = nil
a = a[:len(a)-1]

content_resolved.code:
a[i] = a[len(a)-1]
a[len(a)-1] = nil
a = a[:len(a)-1]
a = append(a[:i], append(make([]T, j), a[i:]...)...)
a = append(a, make([]T, j)...)
a = append(a[:i], append([]T{x}, a[i:]...)...)

title: NOTE
b
The second
append
c
creates a new slice with its own underlying storage and copies elements in
a[i:]
c
to that slice, and these elements are then copied back to slice
a
c
(by the first
append
c
). The creation of the new slice (and thus memory garbage) and the second copy can be avoided by using an alternative way:

to that slice, and these elements are then copied back to slice
). The creation of the new slice (and thus memory garbage) and the second copy can be avoided by using an alternative way:

title:
s = append(s, 0 /* use the zero value of the element type */)
copy(s[i+1:], s[i:])
s[i] = x

content_resolved.code:
s = append(s, 0 /* use the zero value of the element type */)
copy(s[i+1:], s[i:])
s[i] = x
a = append(a[:i], append(b, a[i:]...)...)
a = append(a, x)
x, a = a[len(a)-1], a[:len(a)-1]
a = append([]T{x}, a...)

title: This trick uses the fact that a slice shares the same backing array and capacity as the original, so the storage is reused for the filtered slice. Of course, the original contents are modified.

inline_content.Text: This trick uses the fact that a slice shares the same backing array and capacity as the original, so the storage is reused for the filtered slice. Of course, the original contents are modified.
